title: Staff Engineer, Commerce Systems
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
As a platform company, Stripe processes payments, offers revenue management services, and runs marketplaces, enabling entrepreneurs to start internet businesses from anywhere. Our Commerce Platform powers the backbone of Stripe's internal quote to cash process. It serves as a central entry point for Stripe teams to monetize products globally, efficiently sell, manage contracting, and rapidly onboard users. We build platforms and services to support pricing management, revenue calculation, and collection, empowering both Stripe and our users to understand and manage revenue and costs. We work on customer-facing experiences, internal platforms, and data pipelines to drive business value at every stage of the user and product lifecycle.
What you’ll do
We are seeking an experienced technical leader to drive the technical direction and strategy for Commerce Platform experiences. In this role, you will work closely with engineering managers, senior engineers, and cross-functional partners to design the technical architecture of the product. You will help grow the team in India to become a strong leader in delivering the Commerce Platform vision. You will also have the opportunity to be hands-on in building key systems, while mentoring and leading other engineers. Join us in spearheading a transformational opportunity for Stripe.
Responsibilities

Manage the technical leadership, execution, and roadmap for Commerce Systems in India, including Quote to Cash systems and User Billing systems.
Lead collaboration with counterparts in the US on the technical roadmap and interface with cross-functional teams.
Mentor and support the professional growth of engineers at an early stage in their careers.

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

At least 15 years of engineering experience or equivalent combined work experience demonstrating relevant domain expertise.
Proven experience leading company-wide initiatives or influencing tech roadmap planning and execution.
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively across multiple teams and stakeholders.
Ability to balance execution and velocity with security, reliability, and efficiency.
Past experience mentoring and investing in the development of engineers.
Pride in successfully completing projects involving a diverse range of technologies and systems.
Comfortable working directly with users and exhibiting empathy and a strong customer focus in a cross-geographic environment.

Preferred qualifications

Experience in payment systems.
Familiarity with large scale distributed systems.
Knowledge of quote to cash and revenue management systems.
Experience with Salesforce engineering (not consulting).
Experience working in high-growth teams similar to Stripe.
If you meet the minimum requirements, we encourage you to apply. Preferred qualifications are beneficial but not mandatory.

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
